summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary of a witness, referred to as [REDACTED], conducted on April 24, 2019, under a proffer agreement. The witness details her recruitment as a 14-year-old by a friend to perform sexualized massages for Jeffrey Epstein, her subsequent role in recruiting other underage girls for him, and the progression of abuse. She describes Epstein's preferences, payment methods, and interactions with his staff.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The 'rich guy' who paid for sexualized massages from underage girls. The witness describes his home, routine, preferences for young girls, and his instructions to her.

persons.name: Alexandra Conlon
persons.context: One of the witness's attorneys present during the FBI proffer interview.

persons.name: Alexandra Elonowitz-Hess
persons.context: One of the witness's attorneys present during the FBI proffer interview.

persons.name: Jenna Dabbs
persons.context: One of the witness's attorneys present during the FBI proffer interview.

persons.name: Amanda Young
persons.context: FBI Special Agent present for the witness interview.

persons.name: Leslie Groff
persons.context: Referred to as LESLIE, identified as Epstein's secretary. The witness scheduled massage appointments through her and sometimes collected money from her.

connections.description: Epstein paid the witness for sexualized massages when she was 14-17 years old. She later recruited other girls for him at his direction.
Friend 1 recruited the witness into Epstein's scheme, explaining the process and selling her the 'business' for $1000.
The witness contacted Groff, Epstein's secretary, to schedule appointments for herself and the girls she recruited.
Groff is identified as Epstein's secretary who managed his schedule and facilitated contact with the witness.
The witness and Friend 2 worked as a team to recruit girls for Epstein until he cut off the arrangement to avoid paying both.

events.title: FBI Proffer Interview of Witness
events.description: A witness is interviewed by the FBI under a proffer agreement, providing detailed information about her sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein and her role in recruiting other underage girls for him.

events.title: Witness's Recruitment and Abuse by Epstein
events.description: The witness, at age 14, is recruited by a friend to perform sexualized massages for Jeffrey Epstein. She describes multiple visits to his New York home, the progression of abuse, and her subsequent role in recruiting other girls aged 13-17.

events.title: FBI Visit to Witness's Home
events.description: When the witness was 17-19, FBI agents visited her home. She called Epstein, who told her not to call him anymore and that he would set her up with a lawyer.

events.title: Bedroom Incident with Epstein and Two Girls
events.description: The witness recalls one specific incident where Epstein took her and another girl ([REDACTED Friend 2]) to his bedroom. All were on the bed, Epstein touched the witness, but she does not recall penetration.

locations: New York, New York (location of interview)
Astoria, New York (where witness grew up and attended school)
Epstein's New York home (location of the massages and abuse; described as having an office, massage room, library, kitchen, and bedroom)
3rd Avenue, New York (location of Epstein's office where witness sometimes picked up money)
keyFacts: The witness was 14 years old when first sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein after being recruited by a friend.
The witness subsequently recruited an estimated 20 to 50 other girls, aged 13-17, for Epstein, following his explicit instruction not to bring anyone over 18.
Epstein's secretary, Leslie Groff, facilitated the scheduling of appointments for the massages between the witness and Epstein.
The witness's abuse by Epstein progressed over time from topless massages to him touching her, using a vibrator on her, and a specific incident in his bedroom with another girl.
Epstein paid the witness in cash ($300 per session) and she lived on this income, earning $600-$900 per week at the peak.
